messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 5206
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/6/2005 2:17:51 PM Mountain Standard Time, LauraBourdo@houston.rr.com writes: I  enjoyed your pictures of your kids, Sandra.  I especially
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/6/2005 2:17:51 PM Mountain Standard Time,
LauraBourdo@... writes:

I enjoyed your pictures of your kids, Sandra. I especially liked Cameron's
hair. It suits him so well. I like long hair on guys.


---------

Cameron's not mine, but I like his hair too. His parents are Kelly and Ben
Lovejoy, in SC.
There's a photo of Kirby with long hair at _http://sandradodd.com/kirby_
(http://sandradodd.com/kirby) , but his hair is shorter now, like an inch and a
half or two and fluffy (nice, thick hair).

I'm glad for the ability to put photos up in public sometimes. It's cool.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 5206
messages.msgSnippet: I enjoyed your pictures of your kids, Sandra.  I especially liked Cameron s hair.  It suits him so well.  I like long hair on guys. I think I m the only mom in
messages.messageBody:
I enjoyed your pictures of your kids, Sandra. I especially liked Cameron's
hair. It suits him so well. I like long hair on guys.

I think I'm the only mom in my circle here in Houston (that I've discussed
this with, anyway) who has encouraged her son to grow long hair and a
goatee. Liam would look so good like that, but he keeps his hair buzzed.
At least he's finally growing a goatee. I'm happy. He's happy. It's all
good.

Laura B.

From: SandraDodd@...
Subject: Re: Re: photos of Cameron, Marty and Holly

Those who've seen Marty at conferences probably saw him bald to baldish,
but
in that photo he has hair! <g> He kept his head shaved for three years or
so, and it's nice to see it grown out some. It's curly in the back! We
didn't expect that.

Sandra
